alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 3:13PM MDT until July 19 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Wayne County in southern Utah... * Until 615 PM MDT. * At 313 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Capitol Reef National Park and Fruita. In particular, Sulphur Creek, Cohab Canyon, and Grand Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
